Reviews.Title: “A perfect pied-a-terre in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: delveg
Reviews.Content: The key word is "location". This little gem is located in a strategic position on Kurfurstendamm - one of the most exclusive shopping streets of the city. At walking distance from Charlottengurg and well connected by bus and tube to the rest of the city this no-curfew hotel packed with character is the ideal pied-a-terre for the tourist who is looking to spend more time outside than inside the hotel. I spent 3 nights in a single bed with shared bathroom facilities. The floor was a bit squeaky - bear in mind the hotel was built in the 20's - but the room was clean and room service was provided every day. The mattress - to which I give paramount importance when rating accommodations - got a mere 5 out 10. Also the breakfast, although decent in terms of quality, could be greatly improved by adding a little more variety to it to break the routine. Given the excellent value for money though I would happily swallow the cons and advise this hotel to anyone who is looking for a budget price accommodation in a stunning location of Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great charm, location and value”
Reviews.Author: jst20b
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the " Apartment," which is a bit of a misnomer as there us no kitchen. But one large rm with two beds and one small room with a double bed and a bathroom was perfect for a family of four. We even entertained friends one night in our large front room complete with a piano and 1920's radio. Only complaint was the thin pillows. Great breakfast, helpful staff, comfortable lobby for hanging out, and location can't be beat. And all this for 402 euro. We would gladly return.

Reviews.Title: “charm and affordable”
Reviews.Author: weemacs
Reviews.Content: have stayed here several times before. it has character and history and fun events happening such as tango evenings, picture galleries and musical evenings. the rooms range from small to positively palatial so ask when booking. not forgetting its in the city centre with some of the best style shopping around the corner. fabulously helpful front desk staff

Reviews.Title: “Good Value & Great location”
Reviews.Author: Rodent81
Reviews.Content: Great location around 10 minutes from both a U and S Stations, rooms basic but clean (we had non-ensuite) but great for what we wanted. Breakfast good too. All round good choice.

Reviews.Title: “A really fun hotel!”
Reviews.Author: joannafrancis
Reviews.Content: My husband and I initially stayed at the Bogota because it was near the Ku'Dam but found that there was so much more to like beyond its location. The room was very 'old world Germany', full of charm and quirkiness. The breakfast was wonderful, although we felt the waitstaff hovered a bit too much. The history of the hotel (a former fashion photographer's atelier) led to its attraction but the service will keep us coming back and recommending it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Moderate”
Reviews.Author: Chekie2011
Reviews.Content: I was staying there with my parents in a triple room. The room was pretty basic with shared facilities. I am glad that they put our room near to the bathroom and toilet, which is an easy access for my parents especially during late night. Our room was clean and came with complimentary toiletries. However, the room is a bit small for three people to squeeze in. We hardly move in the room. Also, the hotel provides breakfast. As I don’t know the hotel rates in Berlin, so I wouldn’t comment much on what we’ve paid is what we’ve got :) One thing that thrilled us was the German receptionist who speaks mandarin. He was very helpful and we felt very happy to have someone to speak in common language. That really made us feels much better with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not amazing, but not bad either.”
Reviews.Author: Travelotz11
Reviews.Content: The Bogota Hotel is in a nice area that used to be downtown West Berlin. Alexanderplatz and other main attractions are about 15 mins away by car or 40 mins by underground. The room was clean and had some character, but it wasn't anything special. I was unimpressed by the broken shower door, though it functioned well enough to actually use the shower. The bed wasn't extremely comfortable, and the room was always a little too warm for comfort. The staff was very nice, however, beware of school children. On our last night there were children staying in the room next to us and they were extremely loud after midnight. I had a business meeting the next morning, so I kindly knocked and asked them to quiet down. The children responded by calling our phone repeatedly and loud knocking on the wall. When I complained to the front desk, my wife and I were given another room for the night. It was a very frustrating experience. The complementary breakfast advertised consisted of sliced honeydew, two types of meet, two types of cheese and bread. Dry cereal was also available - nothing to write home about! Hotel Bogota was not a great experience overall, so businessmen beware!

Reviews.Title: “Serenity and charm”
Reviews.Author: hula-girl2011
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for serenity, charm and individuality in your hotel then Hotel Bogata is the place. The sound of chanting monks singing filled the hall on my arrival and beautiful artwork in the atrium indicated that this was not your ordinary hotel. Close to transport, shopping and restaurants this is an ideal place to stay in Berlin if you want a reasonably priced, comfortable but authentic place to rest.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Treasure in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: MarklW
Reviews.Content: I was supposed to stay with friends but last minute one was taken ill so had to find a place to stay, all hotels were booked and the ones that were not were not in my price range. Then I found Hotel Bogota and so pleased I did! I arrived in Berlin early morning (9am) and had the image of having to wait around until 2pm to be able to check in to my room. When I went to the hotel and asked if I could check in immediately at 10.30am the receptionist was extremely helpful and said yes of course. I stayed in a single room (twin room) with shared facilities which was just fine. The hotel has an "olde worldy" feel about it, with lots of interesting pictures and books down in the lobby. I read that the actor Rupert Everett said in 2008 that the Hotel Bogota was "one of Berlin's best kept secrets" Metro and all buses are within 2 - 5 minutes walk and you can buy your tickets at hotel reception. Definitely recommend this hotel and looking forward to returning next year as have more work to do in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Hidden Gem!”
Reviews.Author: ClarenceSurrey
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Fantastic area which didnt match the hotel rates as they were so reasonable. Rooms themselves were comfortable with decent beds. Breakfasts were great!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem - Old World Charm and Service in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: hamburgdude
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights. While the old-style reception area and the 70's carpeting in the halls might throw you at first glance, my room was large, sunny, clean, quiet (looked out onto courtyard) with a completely renovated bathroom. The staff at the reception were extremely polite and helpful whenever I needed advice or help. They also have a broad selection of drinks and snacks, should you arrive late or just need something to snack on during your stay. While I did not use the hotel's computer, I did use the WiFi, and I had no problems. The location is great - just off the Ku'damm and only a few U-Bahn stops from the central station. There are a number of higher-end dining options along Schlueterstrasse as well as some of the best Lebanese fast-food at Mama Falafel around the corner on Pariserstrasse. I have stayed at a number of different hotels in Berlin, but this is my favorite because it's neither a chain hotel nor a soul-less modern design hotel. It feels much more like a "home away from home".

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with character”
Reviews.Author: falcarragh
Reviews.Content: Not a nameless chain hotel, but the price needs to be right as mosy rooms do not have a private bathroom. It is resting on its reputation a bit

Reviews.Title: “my stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: GracenC
Reviews.Content: Very nice old hotel in Berlin...lots of history. The lobby was gorgeous, only one computer, but they do have wifi. The rooms felt a little bit like a hostel, not too bad. Comfy and cozy. Breakfast buffett was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Great for students”
Reviews.Author: Youngeuropelover
Reviews.Content: I stayed in bogota hotel 2 nights. If you use the s-bahn, it is very useful. I stayed with a group of 42students and it was great for us. Even though the rooms are small, they are charming! Loved it! If you want to travel decent, it is a perfect hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Old Berlin at its best”
Reviews.Author: weemacs
Reviews.Content: very central off the Ku'dam, this charming old hotel run by a family offers straight forward accomodation and fare at very good value. excellent staff and on tuesdays listen out for the swing sound from the dining room and its free.

Reviews.Title: “Building Fantastic, Location Decent, Staff So-so”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Fiend_007
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed here in July of 09 and we loved the building. It had so much charm and was so elegantly designed, but too bad that did not rub off on the staff. The rooms were nice and keep in mind the building is older and you are not getting a Hilton here. However, the staff - especially at the front desk - was not very helpful or friendly. It may be because we are a large group of Americans and we can get loud. It happens. Regardless, it seemed as if we were an annoyance and it was better suited to just deal with us in hopes that we would leave soon. With that being said, I would stay here again for the building, but not for the staff. Perhaps we just got them on a bad day. Only a return trip will justify my review.

Reviews.Title: “nice location”
Reviews.Author: lovejumping
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the budget single room which which basically felt like sleeping in a converted store cupboard however, you get what you pay for and the price was spot on as was the breakfast, the location is excellent and its only a 10 minute walk to the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Decent value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tattiehowk
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a triple room. There was enough space, and the bathroom was very clean. You can either have an ensuite room or share the communal bathroon. Having been in both, the communal matched the cleanliness of our room. The staff were helpful and the breakfast ,was OK to start a day sghtseeing. This hotel certainly meets the needs of most travellers.: cheap , coutreous and pleasant. The hotel is within walking distance of both U and S bahns

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: tlajj5
Reviews.Content: Cute hotel in a awesome location!!! Our room was very clean and the staff is very nice. Whatever we needed, they got it. The price was also very good. I would recommend staying here if you want a clean room in a great location!

Reviews.Title: “Lot's Of Character”
Reviews.Author: peaceout11
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 3 days last April with a group of students from my school. It wasn't the best hotel around, but it was cheap and cute. The people were nice, and it was in a GREAT location... essential if you really want to get to see Berlin. I must say that elevator was a little creepy, but I usually just took the stairs... overall, nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money in single room”
Reviews.Author: go2berlin
Reviews.Content: Stayed recently for one night in a single room 44 Euro incl tax and brkfst, this was standard rate for a room without bathroom. Got an upgrade to a single room facing schluterstrasse with shower in the room. No street noise, spotless clean, thin walls (so better use earplugs if you are sensitive) and the best: the staff was extremely friendly and helpful (4 receptionists and breakfast staff), they made my stay to be a very pleasant experience. In my opinion a funny place (look at their website) and a recommendation if you are looking for a cheap, alternative in a great location. All bus stops and luxury good retailers just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but clean in great location”
Reviews.Author: Midgetgem74
Reviews.Content: There was a group of 8 of us stayed at the Bogota last weekend. The hotel was in a great location just off the Ku'damm, so ideal for lots of designer shops. It was a short walk to the central part of the Ku'damm and close to nearest underground and train stop. Buses also run along the Ku'damm to all other areas of Berlin. We stayed for 3 nights. We all had different style rooms. One of us was fortunate enough to get the one room in our party that had a shower in the room (it literally was in the room too). The other 4 rooms all had wash basins. However there wasn't a toilet in any of the rooms but there are several WCs on each floor and also several shower rooms. We didnt find this a problem and I do know that some of the rooms certainly do have en-suites. Our rooms were basic but clean and towels were changed daily. The beds were comfortable. The colour scheme is a bit bright (orange walls) but the public areas of the hotel are nicely decorated. The staff seemed friendly enough at the reception area and you hand your key in whenever you leave so we could always go back to room whenever we needed to without the rest of group(I know another person identified a problem with keys). The desk is staffed all night and there aren't any restrictions on what time of night you return. Check-out is 12 noon. Breakfast however was basic and the restaurant staff were extremely stressed and disorganised, one morning (saturday) they were finding it difficult dealing with quantity of guests and at one point there was no food left at the buffet. Expect cereal (cornflakes or muesli) cold meats and cheeses, bread and a boiled egg as breakfast menu. It was ok. Not sure if I would stay at this hotel again, it was great value for money considering location and at least there is a variety of rooms to suit different budgets.

Reviews.Title: “Good on price and location”
Reviews.Author: dnawilliams
Reviews.Content: The Bogota has a great location just of the Ku'damm in the Savigny Platz area and a good price on rooms. The public spaces of the hotel were very nice, the rooms adequate, and the beds comfortable. On the downside, there is no air-conditioning, the breakfast is mediocre at best, and the walls are extremely thin. In fact, our room was located on the courtyard side of the hotel, which you would have thought would have been quiet, but since there was no air-conditioning, everyone's windows were open and the noise echoed throughout the courtyard. Nevertheless, it was a decent homebase on the Ku'damm at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “I have stayed in better”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was an okay hotel. There is only a small lift. We got stuck in the elevator. Even though it says that it can fit 6 people, it can really only fit about 3. The rooms are fine. There are bathrooms in the room and they also have a public bathroom on each floor. The hotel offers a library where people can go and chat, which is nice. The room has a small tv, but everything is in German, except CNN. The only significant problem that I had was the fact that there was only one room key, so if you were not going to be with your roommate all day you had to delegate a way to handle the key. The hotel is also in a great location. It is on Kurfenstendam, which has lots of shops. Directly across from Bogota is Cartier and Gucci. So, if you love shopping, this is the hotel for you. Overall, I would say that this hotel was good for a European hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointement”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent the bank holiday at Bogota and whilst its location is great, we were thoroughly dissappointed with the staff and service we received. We arrived a day late as we missed our flight (due to circumstances beyond our control) and despite explaining our horrendous journey and the detour we had to take to the management, they insisted we pay for the room we had not used! One would have expected a more sympathetic response! Furthermore, whilst rooms are large, the bathroom/showers are like little holes attached to the room with very little space and very basic amenities. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Disliked this place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Despite this great location, rooms were quite spartan &, down the hall WC, was unacceptable. You either froze or burned yourself in the shower! Included breakfasts - awful. Why bother? Personnel nice, though.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and friendly hotel in great location.”
Reviews.Author: Mike_Montmorency
Reviews.Content: This is a friendly hotel in a great location, just of the Kurfürstendamm. Though the rooms aren't exactly state of the art, our room was well maintained and clean. What the hotel lacks in corporate comfort, it makes up for in quirky and historic details though! These include large hallways on each floor, the fourth floor hallway containing photographs taken by the fashion photographer Yva in the 20/30's. Our room faced the front, which meant it gave us nice views but there was a lot of road noise with the window open. The staff were all friendly, professional and ready to help. Considering the location, this hotel offers good value for money. I would certainly consider staying here again.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Bogota Berlin
HotelInfo.Address: Schlueterstrasse 45 | Kurfürstendamm, 10707 Berlin, Germany
